The plant features spiny stems and small, clustered leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Its flowers are typically greenish or reddish and appear in dense inflorescences. Acanthophyllum conjungens is well adapted to sandy soils and can survive in extreme temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
